title: World's top aluminium producer adds markups as Trump tariffs drive consumer costs
summary: Rio Tinto Group is imposing surcharges on aluminium shipments to the US, ranging from one to three cents above the Midwest premium, translating to an extra $2,006 per tonne on top of the raw metal price. The price for aluminium delivered to the US reached a record high last week as stockpiles shrink, with the surcharge reflecting how deeply Trump's 50% import duty has disrupted the market structure. US warehouses used by the London Metal Exchange have no aluminium inventory remaining after the last 125 tonnes were withdrawn in October.

title: Aluminum fell to 2,846 USD/T on November 17, 2025
summary: Aluminum prices declined 0.49% to $2,846 per tonne on November 17, 2025, though prices remain up 2.60% over the past month and 8.96% compared to the same time last year. The commodity has historically reached an all-time high of $4,103 in March 2022, with current prices tracking near three-year highs amid ongoing supply concerns.

title: Russia's Aluminium Giant Rusal Shuts Key Plant as China's Low-Cost Silicon Crushes Industry
summary: Russia's largest silicon producer, the Kremniy factory owned by Rusal, will halt operations on January 1, 2026, due to collapsing demand for Russian silicon as cheaper Chinese imports flood the market. The shutdown is part of a broader wave of production cuts across Russian heavy industry, with at least ten major companies implementing reduced schedules or closures due to weak domestic demand and falling exports.

title: SMM Flash News: Secondary Aluminum Ingot Social Inventory Dips by 71 mt on Nov 18
summary: Secondary aluminum ingot social inventory decreased by 71 metric tons on November 18, 2025, reflecting current market dynamics in aluminum supply and inventory levels.

title: Inert Anode Aluminum Production: Carbon-Free Future
summary: Inert anode technology in aluminum production offers a revolutionary carbon-free process that could eliminate 400-700 million tonnes of CO₂ emissions annually by 2040-2045. This technology also reduces secondary environmental impacts, improves aluminum purity, and integrates with renewable energy to achieve near-zero lifecycle emissions, positioning aluminum as a sustainable material for the circular economy.

title: Across the Aluminum Value Chain: How Collaboration Drives Decarbonization
summary: The ELYSIS joint venture between Alcoa and Rio Tinto has started up a commercial-scale inert anode cell that emits oxygen instead of CO₂, eliminating direct greenhouse gas emissions in aluminum smelting. This breakthrough supports the production of aluminum with a 40% lower carbon footprint and, combined with recycled content, offers a low-carbon packaging solution, accelerating sustainable aluminum adoption.

title: Pioneering Sustainable Practices: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever Lead with Carbon-Free Smelting Technology
summary: Alcoa, Ball Corporation, and Unilever have collaborated to introduce ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology in consumer packaging, eliminating direct greenhouse gas emissions. This innovation aligns with global climate goals and demonstrates how industrial carbon emissions can be significantly reduced through technological advancement and partnership.

title: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever Pioneer Carbon-Free Aluminum in Consumer Packaging
summary: The first consumer personal and home care packaging using ELYSIS carbon-free aluminum has been unveiled by Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever. The inert anode technology eliminates all direct greenhouse gas emissions by producing oxygen instead of CO₂, marking a significant step in sustainable packaging ahead of COP30.

title: Ball, Unilever Show Green Aluminium Can Work
summary: Ball and Unilever are using aluminum produced with Alcoa's ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology in aerosol cans, combining higher recycled content with low-carbon primary aluminum. This collaboration highlights a critical packaging innovation and supply chain effort to decarbonize aluminum packaging and the broader aluminum sector.

title: European Green Aluminium Summit 2025 to Tackle Sustainability and Policy Challenges
summary: The 3rd European Green Aluminium Summit focuses on advancing green aluminum production, recycling, and circular economy strategies in Europe. It addresses regulatory frameworks like the EU Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism and the Net-Zero Industry Act, highlighting technological innovations and collaborative strategies to accelerate decarbonization in the aluminum industry.

title: ELYSIS Achieves Breakthrough with Commercial-Size Cell: A First in Aluminum Production Using the Inert Anode Technology
summary: ELYSIS announced the successful start-up of its 450 kiloampere inert anode cell, marking a global first in commercial-scale aluminum production using inert anode technology. This milestone represents a significant step toward large-scale, low-carbon aluminum production by eliminating direct greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Steel Rebounds to Highest in November
summary: Steel rebar futures in China reached CNY 3,050 per tonne, the highest since the beginning of November, driven by Beijing's anti-involution policy translating to lower supply. However, steel exports fell by 12.5% year-over-year to 978.2 million tonnes in October, marking the first decline of the year due to protectionist policies from Southeast Asia and Latin America.

title: US Fed's Hawkish Remarks Drive Stainless Steel Below Recent Lows
summary: Stainless steel futures broke below nearly five-year lows to reach 12,310 yuan/mt during Friday's night session, affected by weakened expectations for US Federal Reserve interest rate cuts. Stainless steel mills have lowered prices and are actively shipping goods to boost sales amid the market downturn.

title: US Raw Steel Production Down 0.7 Percent - Week 47, 2025
source: Steel Orbis / American Iron and Steel Institute (AISI)
summary: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending November 15, 2025, was 1.745 million net tons with a capacity utilization rate of 76.2 percent, down 0.7 percent from the previous week. Year-to-date production through November 15, 2025, reached 78.973 million net tons, representing a 3.2 percent increase compared to the same period last year.

title: Global Steel Market Records Mixed Price Movements in Third Week of November 2025
summary: The global steel market experienced mixed price movements during the third week of November 2025, with slight increases recorded in some raw materials.

title: JSW Steel Ltd: Live Stock Update and Price as of November 18, 2025
summary: JSW Steel Ltd stock price decreased by 0.28%, with the current market value at ₹1,166.00 per share as investors assess the stock's performance.

title: Steel Rebounds to Highest in November
summary: Steel rebar futures in China rose to CNY 3,050 per tonne, the highest since early November, amid Beijing's anti-involution policy leading to lower supply. China's crude steel output fell 12% year-on-year in October, marking the lowest monthly output since 2021, with exports declining 12.5% due to protectionist policies in Southeast Asia and Latin America. Demand for rebar remains weak, reflected by a record low construction PMI in October.

title: US raw steel production is down 0.7 percent - week 47, 2025
summary: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending November 15, 2025, was 1.745 million net tons, down 0.7% from the previous week, with a capacity utilization rate of 76.2%. Despite the weekly decline, production increased 8.3% compared to the same week last year. Year-to-date production through November 15 rose 3.2% from the previous year, with capacity utilization at 77%.

title: China's crude steel output drops to lowest level in October at 72 million mt
summary: China's crude steel output fell to 72 million metric tons in October 2025, the lowest level recorded for that month, continuing a trend of declining production amid ongoing domestic challenges.

title: Manufacturing in New York state jumps in November
summary: Manufacturing activity in New York state increased slightly from November 3-10, with firms forecasting improved business conditions despite a dip in optimism. Steel production dipped last week but remained above the year-to-date weekly average. Employment and hours worked rose modestly, while supply availability worsened slightly and input price increases slowed.

title: Chinese steel production remains weak despite rising iron ore imports
summary: Chinese steel production fell 3% year-on-year during Q3 2025 and may have remained weak entering Q4, despite a 7% increase in iron ore imports leading to record-high portside inventories. The property sector crisis continues to suppress domestic steel demand, and the World Steel Association forecasts a 1% decrease in Chinese steel demand for 2026. Rising trade barriers are expected to slow export growth.

title: New EU tariffs on steel and Chinese export controls on rare earths
summary: The EU Commission announced proposed measures to reduce tariff-free steel imports by 47% and increase out-of-quota duties to 50%, alongside enhanced traceability requirements to prevent circumvention. A final decision on ferroalloy restrictions, critical for steel production, is expected on November 18, 2025, reflecting ongoing trade tensions impacting steel capacity and supply chains.

title: Oman at the frontline of the green steel transition
summary: Oman is advancing its integrated steelmaking supply chain with plans to add significant new capacity in pelletizing, direct reduction, and electric arc furnace steelmaking. The country aims to become a regional hub for green iron and steel production by expanding domestic iron ore concentration and low-carbon steel technologies.

title: Rio Tinto's Green Steelmaking Pivot from BioIron to Zesty Technology
summary: Rio Tinto is shifting its green steelmaking focus from BioIron to hydrogen-based Zesty technology, investing $35 million to advance sustainable steel production. The company aims for a 95% reduction in carbon emissions compared to traditional blast furnaces, leveraging renewable agricultural waste and zero reliance on metallurgical coal. This pragmatic approach balances near-term commercial deployment with long-term innovation, positioning Rio Tinto as a leader in green steel.

title: Finnish company turns steel waste into innovative materials
summary: Tapojärvi, a Finnish company, collaborates with an Italian steel plant to recycle steel slag into materials used in asphalt and concrete, reducing raw material needs and carbon emissions. The process also lowers noise, dust, and transportation costs, benefiting nearby communities. This innovation supports the EU's climate goals and preserves jobs in the steel sector through modernization and cleaner production.

title: Steel's carbon emissions dilemma: Retrofitting plants offers big cuts at moderate cost
summary: Researchers from UCL developed a database and economic model to identify cost-effective strategies for reducing carbon emissions in global steel plants. The study highlights that tailored retrofitting and technology upgrades can enable the steel industry to achieve net-zero emissions cost-effectively, but strong government policies and financial incentives are essential for widespread adoption. The findings provide a data-driven roadmap for policymakers and industry leaders.

title: BASF and ExxonMobil Join Forces to Advance Low-Emission Hydrogen Through Methane Pyrolysis Technology
summary: BASF and ExxonMobil are collaborating to develop methane pyrolysis technology that produces low-emission hydrogen and solid carbon, which can be used in steel manufacturing among other industries. A demonstration plant in Texas will validate the technology at scale, aiming to reduce the carbon footprint of hydrogen production and support green transformations in chemical and steel sectors.

title: Rio Tinto partners with Calix to test low-emissions steel making in Western Australia, pauses BioIron
summary: Rio Tinto has partnered with Calix to test low-emissions steelmaking technologies in Western Australia, pausing its BioIron project to focus on more promising pathways. This collaboration aims to advance sustainable steel production methods that reduce carbon emissions significantly, aligning with Rio Tinto's broader decarbonization goals.

title: SSAB Teams Up With EAB for Green Steel
source: Association for Iron & Steel Technology (AIST) Steel News
summary: SSAB and EAB have partnered to supply fossil-free steel, including SSAB Zero™, for use in warehouse fittings, doors, and steel buildings. This collaboration supports the green steel transition by promoting the use of sustainable steel products in construction and infrastructure.

title: Copper slips as macro concerns, firmer dollar weigh
summary: Copper prices fell on Monday, weighed down by a slightly firmer dollar and broader macroeconomic concerns. Benchmark three-month copper on the London Metal Exchange dropped 0.5% to $10,802.50 per metric ton amid cautious market sentiment.

title: Copper slips as macro concerns, firmer dollar weigh - Markets
summary: Benchmark three-month copper on the London Metal Exchange was down 0.5 percent at $10,802.50 per metric ton in official open outcry trading. The decline was attributed to a firmer dollar and ongoing macroeconomic worries affecting demand outlook.

title: The Narrative Around Copper Has Not Changed
summary: Copper prices fell as a slightly firmer dollar and broader macro concerns weighed on prices, with LME copper down 0.5% at $10,802. Markets remain focused on upcoming US economic data for clues on Federal Reserve policy and economic activity. Chinese industrial data has been disappointing, though infrastructure and green energy investments support long-term demand.

title: Comex Copper Settles 0.98% Lower at $5.0000 — Data Talk
summary: Front Month Comex Copper for November delivery lost 4.95 cents per pound, or 0.98%, settling at $5.0000. This marked the largest one-day dollar and percentage decline recently, reflecting market reactions to economic data and uncertainty.

title: Copper prices steady as traders consider US data and progress in ending the shutdown
summary: Copper prices remained steady near $11,000 per ton despite weak near-term demand. Market participants are watching US economic data and political developments, with cautious risk sentiment prevailing. The Shanghai Futures Exchange copper contract showed minimal movement, reflecting uncertainty in the market.

title: Policy change in Argentina may boost Copper mining
summary: Argentina's President Javier Milei is considering policy changes that could enhance copper mining activities in the country. The article also mentions Rio Tinto's ongoing low-emission iron projects and production updates from other miners, highlighting a significant production decrease due to a plant shutdown in October.

title: Copper Ore Bridge Accident in DRC Kills 49, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Lower Overnight
summary: A tragic copper ore bridge accident in the Democratic Republic of Congo resulted in 49 deaths. Meanwhile, LME copper prices fluctuated overnight, opening at $10,796/mt and closing lower at $10,766.5/mt, with limited supply arrivals and weak downstream demand impacting the market.

title: Lara Exploration Announces Filing of the Preliminary Economic Assessment for its Planalto Copper-Gold Project in Brazil
summary: Lara Exploration filed a Preliminary Economic Assessment for its Planalto copper-gold project in Brazil, estimating production of 560 kt of copper and 111 koz of gold over an 18-year mine life. The project aims to produce a clean chalcopyrite concentrate with potential for metallurgical improvements and power cost reductions.

title: Shooting for Canada's next discovery: Star Copper
summary: Star Copper is advancing its copper-gold porphyry discovery in British Columbia, Canada, with recent drilling extending mineralization north and west of the Star Main target. The company plans a 2026 program focusing on step-outs and deeper testing to define the project's larger scale potential.

title: Ivanhoe Mines Extends Birthday Wishes to President of South Africa Ahead of the Formal Opening of the Platreef Mine
summary: Ivanhoe Mines announced the formal opening of the Platreef mine, a multi-metal project including copper, in South Africa. The company is also exploring for copper in several regions including the Western Forelands and other international locations, highlighting its growth ambitions in copper exploration.

title: Los Andes Copper at 121 Mining Investment London
summary: Los Andes Copper Ltd. presented at the 121 Mining Investment conference in London, highlighting its Vizcachitas Project in Chile. The project is one of the largest copper deposits in the Americas not controlled by major companies and is progressing towards production.

title: Buenaventura to Host Investor Day on November 18, 2025 in New York
summary: Compañía de Minas Buenaventura, Peru's largest publicly traded precious and base metals company, announced its upcoming Investor Day event. The company operates several mines in Peru and holds a significant stake in Sociedad Minera Cerro Verde, a major Peruvian copper producer.

title: Economic Impact Study (2025 11 18 Gunnison Cu Corp Red Cloud)
summary: Gunnison Copper Corp. released information related to its economic impact study and corporate presentation, focusing on its copper projects. The company is listed on the TSX and is advancing its copper exploration and development activities.

title: AI boom pushes copper toward a supply crunch, BNEF warns
summary: A new BloombergNEF report warns that the surge in artificial intelligence and data center construction is increasing copper demand by 400,000 tonnes annually, exacerbating existing supply pressures from the energy transition. The report forecasts copper prices could reach $13,500 per tonne by 2028, highlighting the urgent need for innovation and sustainable supply solutions.

title: Goldman lowers copper supply forecast on Grasberg disruption, sees deficit in 2025
summary: Goldman Sachs has revised its global copper supply forecast downward due to disruptions at Indonesia's Grasberg mine, shifting the 2025 market balance from surplus to deficit. The event underscores the fragility of copper supply chains and the importance of sustainable mining innovations to meet growing demand.

title: One and One Green Technologies INC Reports Strong First Half 2025 Results
summary: One and One Green Technologies reported a 51% revenue increase and 60% net income growth in the first half of 2025, driven by expansion in green technology solutions including sustainable copper processing. The company's strong performance highlights the growing market for environmentally friendly copper technology innovations.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel prices plummeted on November 18 breaking through multiple key support levels
summary: On November 18, the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaged 116,950 yuan/mt, down 1,750 yuan/mt from the previous day. The SHFE nickel contract fell 1.66%, breaking the 116,000 yuan/mt support level amid hawkish US Fed signals and high market inventory, suggesting short-term weakness in nickel prices.

title: FLASH: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in November Period I
summary: The Indonesia Nickel Miners Association set benchmark prices for nickel ore for the first half of November 2025, with a reference price of $15,075.33/wmt, down 0.44% from late October. Prices for different nickel content grades also declined slightly compared to the previous period.

title: Nickel Price Collapse Forces Market Repricing as Oversupply & Weak Demand Challenge Producers
summary: Nickel prices have fallen to around US$15,000/t in mid-2025, down 10% year-over-year, with 32% of production offline due to margin stress. Oversupply persists with a forecasted 198,000t surplus in 2025 and record inventories, driven by Indonesian output despite quotas. Trade tariffs and policy shifts are causing supply chain realignment, creating pricing bifurcation and long-term market restructuring.

title: Nickel futures at LME rebound on Nov 18
summary: On November 18, nickel spot price at the London Metal Exchange rose by US$194/ton to US$15,486/ton. Meanwhile, LME nickel inventory increased by 4,722 tons to 159,146 tons, indicating a rebound in nickel futures prices despite high stock levels.

title: Nickel pivot sparks legal debate in mining sector
summary: Indonesia's government faces legal debate over new nickel mining policies aimed at addressing global nickel surplus and curbing new market entrants. The policy shift focuses on downstream production of higher-value nickel products, raising investment thresholds and impacting existing license holders. Indonesia and China contribute 75% of global supply, with Indonesia seen as a key factor in declining global nickel prices.

title: FLASH: Nickel Industries Q3 2025 nickel production up 2.38% Quarter-on-Quarter
summary: Nickel Industries Limited reported a 2.38% increase in nickel production for Q3 2025, reaching 31,148 tonnes. The company's RKEF projects saw a 1.29% rise in nickel pig iron output, while the HPAL projects also contributed to growth despite ongoing maintenance at one facility.

title: Nornickel maintains 2025 nickel production forecast
summary: Nornickel reported an 18% increase in nickel production for Q3 2025, reaching 54,000 metric tons, and maintained its annual forecast at 196,000–204,000 metric tons. The rise was attributed to higher volumes of processed raw materials after seasonal disruptions.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel prices fell to 14,531.25 USD/tonne on November 18, 2025, down 0.20% from the previous day. LME warehouse stockpiles have risen significantly, reflecting ample supply, while demand remains mixed due to weaker stainless steel purchasing and stronger EV sector usage.

title: Aqua Metals and Westwin Elements Sign LOI for U.S.-Produced Battery-Grade Nickel Carbonate
summary: Aqua Metals has signed a letter of intent with Westwin Elements to develop one of the first domestic sources of battery-grade nickel carbonate in the United States. The company's proprietary AquaRefining™ technology delivers high-purity, low-carbon battery materials while reducing emissions and supporting a circular supply chain for critical minerals essential to electric vehicles and grid storage.

title: Nornickel Upgrades Catalyst in Sulphur Program
summary: Nornickel has begun replacing the vanadium catalyst in the contact apparatuses at its Sulphur Program at the Nadezhda Smelter. This upgrade represents an operational improvement in the company's nickel processing infrastructure.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first consolidated Group Sustainability Report, highlighting that over 94% of the electricity used by the Group came from certified renewable sources by the end of 2024. The report demonstrates the company's commitment to sustainability as an integral part of its corporate strategy, with CEO Massimiliano Burelli emphasizing that sustainability is not just a reporting obligation but a key driver of long-term value creation.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Tenaris posts surprise 2% rise in sales on stable US, Canada drilling
summary: Tenaris, the Italian steel pipe maker, reported a 2% increase in third-quarter net sales to $2.98 billion, driven by stable drilling activity in the US and Canada. Despite this, the company warned that margins would be impacted by the full effect of tariff costs, with challenges in other regions such as Europe and Argentina.

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris hosted a panel discussion in Italy focusing on the strategic role of nuclear energy in Europe's energy transition and Italy's boilermaking industry. The company highlighted its accreditation to supply certified materials for nuclear facilities, emphasizing quality and safety standards aligned with international codes.

title: Tenaris Acquires isOplus Oil and Gas Division in $10M Deal, Expands Pipe Coating Business
summary: Tenaris acquired the oil and gas division of isOplus for $10 million, rebranding it as Tenaris Coating Italy. This acquisition enhances Tenaris's capabilities in anti-corrosion coatings for pipelines, aiming to reduce delivery times, maintain quality, and lower environmental impact with coating operations in Italy and other countries.

title: Tenaris to supply pipes and coating solutions for Subsea7's Búzios 9 project in Brazil
summary: Tenaris will supply 102 km of carbon steel pipes and thermal insulation coating for Subsea7's Búzios 9 project operated by Petrobras in Brazil. The steel pipes will be manufactured at Tenaris's Dalmine plant in Italy, with coating performed in Brazil, strengthening Tenaris's position in the Brazilian offshore market.

title: Prysmian shares rise as Italian cable maker seen as winner amid US copper tariffs
summary: Prysmian shares rose as analysts identified the Italian cable manufacturer as a potential winner from President Trump's proposed 50% copper tariff. The company's vertically integrated copper operations, including sourcing from a Freeport mine in Arizona and operating its own copper rod mill in Texas, give it a competitive advantage over smaller competitors.

title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
summary: Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 guidance after posting third-quarter revenue of €5.03 billion, exceeding consensus expectations. The company's Renewable Transmission segment posted 39% organic growth, while Power Grids grew 15% organically, with strong performance in North America and Europe driving the upgraded outlook.

title: Italian expertise fuels Prysmian innovation
summary: Prysmian announced plans to allocate €270 million in R&D investment by 2028, building on €216 million invested between 2021 and 2024. The company's Milan R&D hub, with 130 professionals, supports 27 global R&D centers and has received over €5.5 million in funding from Italian authorities for submarine energy cables and renewable energy integration projects.
